text: XXX .
text_tokenized: XXX .

text: Sir William stayed only a week at Hunsford ; but his visit was long enough to convince him of his daughter ’s being most comfortably settled , and of her possessing such a husband and such a neighbour as were not often met with .
text_tokenized: Sir William stayed only a week at Hunsford ; but his visit was long enough to convince him of his daughter ’s being most comfortably settled , and of her possessing such a husband and such a neighbour as were not often met with .

text: While Sir William was with them , Mr. Collins devoted his mornings to driving him out in his gig , and showing him the country : but when he went away , the whole family returned to their usual employments , and Elizabeth was thankful to find that they did not see more of her cousin by the alteration ; for the chief of the time between breakfast and dinner was now passed by him either at work in the garden , or in reading and writing , and looking out of window in his own book room , which fronted the road .
text_tokenized: While Sir William was with them , Mr. Collins devoted his mornings to driving him out in his gig , and showing him the country : but when he went away , the whole family returned to their usual employments , and Elizabeth was thankful to find that they did not see more of her cousin by the alteration ; for the chief of the time between breakfast and dinner was now passed by him either at work in the garden , or in reading and writing , and looking out of window in his own book room , which fronted the road .

text: The room in which the ladies sat was backwards .
text_tokenized: The room in which the ladies sat was backwards .

text: Elizabeth at first had rather wondered that Charlotte should not prefer the dining parlour for common use ; it was a better sized room , and had a pleasanter aspect : but she soon saw that her friend had an excellent reason for what she did , for Mr. Collins would undoubtedly have been much less in his own apartment had they sat in one equally lively ; and she gave Charlotte credit for the arrangement .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth at first had rather wondered that Charlotte should not prefer the dining parlour for common use ; it was a better sized room , and had a pleasanter aspect : but she soon saw that her friend had an excellent reason for what she did , for Mr. Collins would undoubtedly have been much less in his own apartment had they sat in one equally lively ; and she gave Charlotte credit for the arrangement .

text: From the drawing - room they could distinguish nothing in the lane , and were indebted to Mr. Collins for the knowledge of what carriages went along , and how often especially Miss De Bourgh drove by in her phaeton , which he never failed coming to inform them of , though it happened almost every day .
text_tokenized: From the drawing - room they could distinguish nothing in the lane , and were indebted to Mr. Collins for the knowledge of what carriages went along , and how often especially Miss De Bourgh drove by in her phaeton , which he never failed coming to inform them of , though it happened almost every day .

text: She not unfrequently stopped at the Parsonage , and had a few minutes ’ conversation with Charlotte , but was scarcely ever prevailed on to get out .
text_tokenized: She not unfrequently stopped at the Parsonage , and had a few minutes ’ conversation with Charlotte , but was scarcely ever prevailed on to get out .

text: Very few days passed in which Mr. Collins did not walk to Rosings , and not many in which his wife did not think it necessary to go likewise ; and till Elizabeth recollected that there might be other family livings to be disposed of , she could not understand the sacrifice of so many hours .
text_tokenized: Very few days passed in which Mr. Collins did not walk to Rosings , and not many in which his wife did not think it necessary to go likewise ; and till Elizabeth recollected that there might be other family livings to be disposed of , she could not understand the sacrifice of so many hours .

text: Now and then they were honoured with a call from her Ladyship , and nothing escaped her observation that was passing in the room during these visits .
text_tokenized: Now and then they were honoured with a call from her Ladyship , and nothing escaped her observation that was passing in the room during these visits .

text: She examined into their employments , looked at their work , and advised them to do it differently ; found fault with the arrangement of the furniture , or detected the housemaid in negligence ; and if she accepted any refreshment , seemed to do it only for the sake of finding out that Mrs. Collins ’s joints of meat were too large for her family .
text_tokenized: She examined into their employments , looked at their work , and advised them to do it differently ; found fault with the arrangement of the furniture , or detected the housemaid in negligence ; and if she accepted any refreshment , seemed to do it only for the sake of finding out that Mrs. Collins ’s joints of meat were too large for her family .

text: Elizabeth soon perceived , that though this great lady was not in the commission of the peace for the county , she was a most active magistrate in her own parish , the minutest concerns of which were carried to her by Mr. Collins ; and whenever any of the cottagers were disposed to be quarrelsome , discontented , or too poor , she sallied forth into the village to settle their differences , silence their complaints , and scold them into harmony and plenty .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth soon perceived , that though this great lady was not in the commission of the peace for the county , she was a most active magistrate in her own parish , the minutest concerns of which were carried to her by Mr. Collins ; and whenever any of the cottagers were disposed to be quarrelsome , discontented , or too poor , she sallied forth into the village to settle their differences , silence their complaints , and scold them into harmony and plenty .

text_tokenized: [ Illustration : “ he never failed to inform them ”

text: ] The entertainment of dining at Rosings was repeated about twice a week ; and , allowing for the loss of Sir William , and there being only one card - table in the evening , every such entertainment was the counterpart of the first .
text_tokenized: ] The entertainment of dining at Rosings was repeated about twice a week ; and , allowing for the loss of Sir William , and there being only one card - table in the evening , every such entertainment was the counterpart of the first .

text: Their other engagements were few , as the style of living of the neighbourhood in general was beyond the Collinses ’ reach .
text_tokenized: Their other engagements were few , as the style of living of the neighbourhood in general was beyond the Collinses ’ reach .

text: This , however , was no evil to Elizabeth , and upon the whole she spent her time comfortably enough : there were half hours of pleasant conversation with Charlotte , and the weather was so fine for the time of year , that she had often great enjoyment out of doors .
text_tokenized: This , however , was no evil to Elizabeth , and upon the whole she spent her time comfortably enough : there were half hours of pleasant conversation with Charlotte , and the weather was so fine for the time of year , that she had often great enjoyment out of doors .

text: Her favourite walk , and where she frequently went while the others were calling on Lady Catherine , was along the open grove which edged that side of the park , where there was a nice sheltered path , which no one seemed to value but herself , and where she felt beyond the reach of Lady Catherine ’s curiosity .
text_tokenized: Her favourite walk , and where she frequently went while the others were calling on Lady Catherine , was along the open grove which edged that side of the park , where there was a nice sheltered path , which no one seemed to value but herself , and where she felt beyond the reach of Lady Catherine ’s curiosity .

text: In this quiet way the first fortnight of her visit soon passed away .
text_tokenized: In this quiet way the first fortnight of her visit soon passed away .

text: Easter was approaching , and the week preceding it was to bring an addition to the family at Rosings , which in so small a circle must be important .
text_tokenized: Easter was approaching , and the week preceding it was to bring an addition to the family at Rosings , which in so small a circle must be important .

text: Elizabeth had heard , soon after her arrival , that Mr. Darcy was expected there in the course of a few weeks ; and though there were not many of her acquaintance whom she did not prefer , his coming would furnish one comparatively new to look at in their Rosings parties , and she might be amused in seeing how hopeless Miss Bingley ’s designs on him were , by his behaviour to his cousin , for whom he was evidently destined by Lady Catherine , who talked of his coming with the greatest satisfaction , spoke of him in terms of the highest admiration , and
text_tokenized: Elizabeth had heard , soon after her arrival , that Mr. Darcy was expected there in the course of a few weeks ; and though there were not many of her acquaintance whom she did not prefer , his coming would furnish one comparatively new to look at in their Rosings parties , and she might be amused in seeing how hopeless Miss Bingley ’s designs on him were , by his behaviour to his cousin , for whom he was evidently destined by Lady Catherine , who talked of his coming with the greatest satisfaction , spoke of him in terms of the highest admiration , and

text: seemed almost angry to find that he had already been frequently seen by Miss Lucas and herself .
text_tokenized: seemed almost angry to find that he had already been frequently seen by Miss Lucas and herself .

text: His arrival was soon known at the Parsonage ; for Mr. Collins was walking the whole morning within view of the lodges opening into Hunsford Lane , in order to have [ Illustration : “ The gentlemen accompanied him . ” [ _ Copyright 1894 by George Allen . _ ] ] the earliest assurance of it ; and , after making his bow as the carriage turned into the park , hurried home with the great intelligence .
text_tokenized: His arrival was soon known at the Parsonage ; for Mr. Collins was walking the whole morning within view of the lodges opening into Hunsford Lane , in order to have [ Illustration : “ The gentlemen accompanied him . ” [ _ Copyright 1894 by George Allen . _ ] ] the earliest assurance of it ; and , after making his bow as the carriage turned into the park , hurried home with the great intelligence .

text: On the following morning he hastened to Rosings to pay his respects .
text_tokenized: On the following morning he hastened to Rosings to pay his respects .

text: There were two nephews of Lady Catherine to require them , for Mr. Darcy had brought with him a Colonel Fitzwilliam , the younger son of his uncle , Lord ---- ; and , to the great surprise of all the party , when Mr. Collins returned , the gentlemen accompanied him .
text_tokenized: There were two nephews of Lady Catherine to require them , for Mr. Darcy had brought with him a Colonel Fitzwilliam , the younger son of his uncle , Lord ---- ; and , to the great surprise of all the party , when Mr. Collins returned , the gentlemen accompanied him .

text: Charlotte had seen them from her husband ’s room , crossing the road , and immediately running into the other , told the girls what an honour they might expect , adding,-- “ I may thank you , Eliza , for this piece of civility .
text_tokenized: Charlotte had seen them from her husband ’s room , crossing the road , and immediately running into the other , told the girls what an honour they might expect , adding,-- “ I may thank you , Eliza , for this piece of civility .

text: Mr. Darcy would never have come so soon to wait upon me . ”
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy would never have come so soon to wait upon me . ”

text: Elizabeth had scarcely time to disclaim all right to the compliment before their approach was announced by the door - bell , and shortly afterwards the three gentlemen entered the room .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth had scarcely time to disclaim all right to the compliment before their approach was announced by the door - bell , and shortly afterwards the three gentlemen entered the room .

text: Colonel Fitzwilliam , who led the way , was about thirty , not handsome , but in person and address most truly the gentleman .
text_tokenized: Colonel Fitzwilliam , who led the way , was about thirty , not handsome , but in person and address most truly the gentleman .

text: Mr. Darcy looked just as he had been used to look in Hertfordshire , paid his compliments , with his usual reserve , to Mrs. Collins ; and whatever might be his feelings towards her friend , met her with every appearance of composure .
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy looked just as he had been used to look in Hertfordshire , paid his compliments , with his usual reserve , to Mrs. Collins ; and whatever might be his feelings towards her friend , met her with every appearance of composure .

text: Elizabeth merely courtesied to him , without saying a word .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth merely courtesied to him , without saying a word .

text: Colonel Fitzwilliam entered into conversation directly , with the readiness and ease of a well - bred man , and talked very pleasantly ; but his cousin , after having addressed a slight observation on the house and garden to Mrs. Collins , sat for some time without speaking to anybody .
text_tokenized: Colonel Fitzwilliam entered into conversation directly , with the readiness and ease of a well - bred man , and talked very pleasantly ; but his cousin , after having addressed a slight observation on the house and garden to Mrs. Collins , sat for some time without speaking to anybody .

text: At length , however , his civility was so far awakened as to inquire of Elizabeth after the health of her family .
text_tokenized: At length , however , his civility was so far awakened as to inquire of Elizabeth after the health of her family .

text: She answered him in the usual way ; and , after a moment ’s pause , added,-- “ My eldest sister has been in town these three months .
text_tokenized: She answered him in the usual way ; and , after a moment ’s pause , added,-- “ My eldest sister has been in town these three months .

text: Have you never happened to see her there ?
text_tokenized: Have you never happened to see her there ?

text: She was perfectly sensible that he never had : but she wished to see whether he would betray any consciousness of what had passed between the Bingleys and Jane ; and she thought he looked a little confused as he answered that he had never been so fortunate as to meet Miss Bennet .
text_tokenized: She was perfectly sensible that he never had : but she wished to see whether he would betray any consciousness of what had passed between the Bingleys and Jane ; and she thought he looked a little confused as he answered that he had never been so fortunate as to meet Miss Bennet .

text: The subject was pursued no further , and the gentlemen soon afterwards went away .
text_tokenized: The subject was pursued no further , and the gentlemen soon afterwards went away .

text: [ Illustration : “ At Church ” ]
text_tokenized: [ Illustration : “ At Church ” ]

text: XXXI .
text_tokenized: XXXI .

text: Colonel Fitzwilliam ’s manners were very much admired at the Parsonage , and the ladies all felt that he must add considerably to the pleasure of their engagements at Rosings . It was some days , however , before they received any invitation thither , for while there were visitors in the house they could not be necessary ; and it was not till Easter - day , almost a week after the gentlemen ’s arrival , that they were honoured by such an attention , and then they were merely asked on leaving church to come there in the evening .
text_tokenized: Colonel Fitzwilliam ’s manners were very much admired at the Parsonage , and the ladies all felt that he must add considerably to the pleasure of their engagements at Rosings . It was some days , however , before they received any invitation thither , for while there were visitors in the house they could not be necessary ; and it was not till Easter - day , almost a week after the gentlemen ’s arrival , that they were honoured by such an attention , and then they were merely asked on leaving church to come there in the evening .

text: For the last week they had seen very little of either Lady Catherine or her daughter .
text_tokenized: For the last week they had seen very little of either Lady Catherine or her daughter .

text: Colonel Fitzwilliam had called at the Parsonage more than once during the time , but Mr. Darcy they had
text_tokenized: Colonel Fitzwilliam had called at the Parsonage more than once during the time , but Mr. Darcy they had

text: only
text_tokenized: only

text: seen at church .
text_tokenized: seen at church .

text: The invitation was accepted , of course , and at a proper hour they joined the party in Lady Catherine ’s drawing - room .
text_tokenized: The invitation was accepted , of course , and at a proper hour they joined the party in Lady Catherine ’s drawing - room .

text: Her Ladyship received them civilly , but it was plain that their company was by no means so acceptable as when she could get nobody else ; and she was , in fact , almost engrossed by her nephews , speaking to them , especially to Darcy , much more than to any other person in the room .
text_tokenized: Her Ladyship received them civilly , but it was plain that their company was by no means so acceptable as when she could get nobody else ; and she was , in fact , almost engrossed by her nephews , speaking to them , especially to Darcy , much more than to any other person in the room .

text: Colonel Fitzwilliam seemed really glad to see them : anything was a welcome relief to him at Rosings ; and Mrs. Collins ’s pretty friend had , moreover , caught his fancy very much .
text_tokenized: Colonel Fitzwilliam seemed really glad to see them : anything was a welcome relief to him at Rosings ; and Mrs. Collins ’s pretty friend had , moreover , caught his fancy very much .

text: He now seated himself by her , and talked so agreeably of Kent and Hertfordshire , of travelling and staying at home , of new books and music , that Elizabeth had never been half so well entertained in that room before ; and they conversed with so much spirit and flow as to draw the attention of Lady Catherine herself , as well as of Mr. Darcy .
text_tokenized: He now seated himself by her , and talked so agreeably of Kent and Hertfordshire , of travelling and staying at home , of new books and music , that Elizabeth had never been half so well entertained in that room before ; and they conversed with so much spirit and flow as to draw the attention of Lady Catherine herself , as well as of Mr. Darcy .

text: _ His _ eyes had been soon and repeatedly turned towards them with a look of curiosity ; and that her Ladyship , after a while , shared the feeling , was more openly acknowledged , for she did not scruple to call out,-- “ What is that you are saying , Fitzwilliam ?
text_tokenized: _ His _ eyes had been soon and repeatedly turned towards them with a look of curiosity ; and that her Ladyship , after a while , shared the feeling , was more openly acknowledged , for she did not scruple to call out,-- “ What is that you are saying , Fitzwilliam ?

text: What is it you are talking of ?
text_tokenized: What is it you are talking of ?

text: What are you telling Miss Bennet ?
text_tokenized: What are you telling Miss Bennet ?

text: Let me hear what it is .
text_tokenized: Let me hear what it is .

text: “ We were talking of music , madam , ” said he , when no longer able to avoid a reply .
text_tokenized: “ We were talking of music , madam , ” said he , when no longer able to avoid a reply .

text: “ Of music !
text_tokenized: “ Of music !

text: Then pray speak aloud .
text_tokenized: Then pray speak aloud .

text: It is of all subjects my delight .
text_tokenized: It is of all subjects my delight .

text: I must have my share in the conversation , if you are speaking of music .
text_tokenized: I must have my share in the conversation , if you are speaking of music .

text: There are few people in England , I suppose , who have more true enjoyment of music than myself , or a better natural taste .
text_tokenized: There are few people in England , I suppose , who have more true enjoyment of music than myself , or a better natural taste .

text: If I had ever learnt , I should have been a great proficient .
text_tokenized: If I had ever learnt , I should have been a great proficient .

text: And so would Anne , if her health had allowed her to apply .
text_tokenized: And so would Anne , if her health had allowed her to apply .

text: I am confident that she would have performed delightfully .
text_tokenized: I am confident that she would have performed delightfully .

text: How does Georgiana get on , Darcy ? ” Mr. Darcy spoke with affectionate praise of his sister ’s proficiency .
text_tokenized: How does Georgiana get on , Darcy ? ” Mr. Darcy spoke with affectionate praise of his sister ’s proficiency .

text: “ I am very glad to hear such a good account of her , ” said Lady Catherine ; “ and pray tell her from me , that she can not expect to excel , if she does not practise a great deal . ”
text_tokenized: “ I am very glad to hear such a good account of her , ” said Lady Catherine ; “ and pray tell her from me , that she can not expect to excel , if she does not practise a great deal . ”

text: “ I assure you , madam , ” he replied , “ that she does not need such advice .
text_tokenized: “ I assure you , madam , ” he replied , “ that she does not need such advice .

text: She practises very constantly . ”
text_tokenized: She practises very constantly . ”

text: “ So much the better .
text_tokenized: “ So much the better .

text: It can not be done too much ; and when I next write to her , I shall charge her not to neglect it on any account .
text_tokenized: It can not be done too much ; and when I next write to her , I shall charge her not to neglect it on any account .

text: I often tell young ladies , that no excellence in music is to be acquired without constant practice .
text_tokenized: I often tell young ladies , that no excellence in music is to be acquired without constant practice .

text: I have told Miss Bennet several times , that she will never play really well , unless she practises more ; and though Mrs. Collins has no instrument , she is very welcome , as I have often told her , to come to Rosings every day , and play on the pianoforte in Mrs. Jenkinson ’s room .
text_tokenized: I have told Miss Bennet several times , that she will never play really well , unless she practises more ; and though Mrs. Collins has no instrument , she is very welcome , as I have often told her , to come to Rosings every day , and play on the pianoforte in Mrs. Jenkinson ’s room .

text: She would be in nobody ’s way , you know , in that part of the house . ”
text_tokenized: She would be in nobody ’s way , you know , in that part of the house . ”

text: Mr. Darcy looked a little ashamed of his aunt ’s ill - breeding , and made no answer .
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy looked a little ashamed of his aunt ’s ill - breeding , and made no answer .

text: When coffee was over , Colonel Fitzwilliam reminded Elizabeth of having promised to play to him ; and she sat down directly to the instrument .
text_tokenized: When coffee was over , Colonel Fitzwilliam reminded Elizabeth of having promised to play to him ; and she sat down directly to the instrument .

text: He drew a chair near her .
text_tokenized: He drew a chair near her .

text: Lady Catherine listened to half a song , and then talked , as before , to her other nephew ; till the latter walked away from her , and moving with his usual deliberation towards the pianoforte , stationed himself so as to command a full view of the fair performer ’s countenance .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine listened to half a song , and then talked , as before , to her other nephew ; till the latter walked away from her , and moving with his usual deliberation towards the pianoforte , stationed himself so as to command a full view of the fair performer ’s countenance .

text: Elizabeth saw what he was doing , and at the first convenient pause turned to him with an arch smile , and said,-- “ You mean to frighten me , Mr. Darcy , by coming in all this state to hear me .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth saw what he was doing , and at the first convenient pause turned to him with an arch smile , and said,-- “ You mean to frighten me , Mr. Darcy , by coming in all this state to hear me .

text: But I will not be alarmed , though your sister _ does _ play so well .
text_tokenized: But I will not be alarmed , though your sister _ does _ play so well .

text: There is a stubbornness about me that never can bear to be frightened at the will of others .
text_tokenized: There is a stubbornness about me that never can bear to be frightened at the will of others .

text: My courage always rises with every attempt to intimidate me . ”
text_tokenized: My courage always rises with every attempt to intimidate me . ”

text: “ I shall not say that you are mistaken , ” he replied , “ because you could not really believe me to entertain any design of alarming you ; and I have had the pleasure of your acquaintance long enough to know , that you find great enjoyment in occasionally professing opinions which , in fact , are not your own . ”
text_tokenized: “ I shall not say that you are mistaken , ” he replied , “ because you could not really believe me to entertain any design of alarming you ; and I have had the pleasure of your acquaintance long enough to know , that you find great enjoyment in occasionally professing opinions which , in fact , are not your own . ”

text: Elizabeth laughed heartily at this picture of herself , and said to Colonel Fitzwilliam , “ Your cousin will give you a very pretty notion of me , and teach you not to believe a word I say .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth laughed heartily at this picture of herself , and said to Colonel Fitzwilliam , “ Your cousin will give you a very pretty notion of me , and teach you not to believe a word I say .

text: I am particularly unlucky in meeting with a person so well able to expose my real character , in a part of the world where I had hoped to pass myself off with some degree of credit .
text_tokenized: I am particularly unlucky in meeting with a person so well able to expose my real character , in a part of the world where I had hoped to pass myself off with some degree of credit .

text: Indeed , Mr. Darcy , it is very ungenerous in you to mention all that you knew to my disadvantage in Hertfordshire -- and , give me leave to say , very impolitic too -- for it is provoking me to retaliate , and such things may come out as will shock your relations to hear . ”
text_tokenized: Indeed , Mr. Darcy , it is very ungenerous in you to mention all that you knew to my disadvantage in Hertfordshire -- and , give me leave to say , very impolitic too -- for it is provoking me to retaliate , and such things may come out as will shock your relations to hear . ”

text: “ I am not afraid of you , ” said he , smilingly .
text_tokenized: “ I am not afraid of you , ” said he , smilingly .

text: “ Pray let me hear what you have to accuse him of
text_tokenized: “ Pray let me hear what you have to accuse him of

text: , ” cried Colonel Fitzwilliam .
text_tokenized: , ” cried Colonel Fitzwilliam .

text: “ I should like to know how he behaves among strangers . ”
text_tokenized: “ I should like to know how he behaves among strangers . ”

text: “ You shall hear , then -- but prepare for something very dreadful .
text_tokenized: “ You shall hear , then -- but prepare for something very dreadful .

text: The first time of my ever seeing him in Hertfordshire , you must know , was at a ball -- and at this ball , what do you think he did ?
text_tokenized: The first time of my ever seeing him in Hertfordshire , you must know , was at a ball -- and at this ball , what do you think he did ?

text: He danced only four dances !
text_tokenized: He danced only four dances !

text: I am sorry to pain you , but so it was .
text_tokenized: I am sorry to pain you , but so it was .

text: He danced only four dances , though gentlemen were scarce ; and , to my certain knowledge , more than one young lady was sitting down in want of a partner .
text_tokenized: He danced only four dances , though gentlemen were scarce ; and , to my certain knowledge , more than one young lady was sitting down in want of a partner .

text: Mr. Darcy ,
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy ,

text: you can not deny the fact .
text_tokenized: you can not deny the fact .

text: ” “ I had not at that time the honour of knowing any lady in the assembly beyond my own party . ”
text_tokenized: ” “ I had not at that time the honour of knowing any lady in the assembly beyond my own party . ”

text: “ True ; and nobody can ever be introduced in a ball - room .
text_tokenized: “ True ; and nobody can ever be introduced in a ball - room .

text: Well , Colonel Fitzwilliam , what do I play next ?
text_tokenized: Well , Colonel Fitzwilliam , what do I play next ?

text: My fingers wait your orders . ”
text_tokenized: My fingers wait your orders . ”

text: “ Perhaps , ” said Darcy , “ I should have judged better had I sought an introduction , but I am ill - qualified to recommend myself to strangers . ”
text_tokenized: “ Perhaps , ” said Darcy , “ I should have judged better had I sought an introduction , but I am ill - qualified to recommend myself to strangers . ”

text: “ Shall we ask your cousin the reason of this ? ” said Elizabeth , still addressing Colonel Fitzwilliam .
text_tokenized: “ Shall we ask your cousin the reason of this ? ” said Elizabeth , still addressing Colonel Fitzwilliam .

text: “ Shall we ask him why a man of sense and education , and who has lived in the world , is ill - qualified to recommend himself to strangers ? ”
text_tokenized: “ Shall we ask him why a man of sense and education , and who has lived in the world , is ill - qualified to recommend himself to strangers ? ”

text: “ I can answer your question , ” said Fitzwilliam , “ without applying to him .
text_tokenized: “ I can answer your question , ” said Fitzwilliam , “ without applying to him .

text: It is because he will not give himself the trouble . ” “ I certainly have not the talent which some people possess , ” said Darcy , “ of conversing easily with those I have never seen before .
text_tokenized: It is because he will not give himself the trouble . ” “ I certainly have not the talent which some people possess , ” said Darcy , “ of conversing easily with those I have never seen before .

text: I can not catch their tone of conversation , or appear interested in their concerns , as I often see done . ”
text_tokenized: I can not catch their tone of conversation , or appear interested in their concerns , as I often see done . ”

text: “ My fingers , ” said Elizabeth , “ do not move over this instrument in the masterly manner which I see so many women ’s do .
text_tokenized: “ My fingers , ” said Elizabeth , “ do not move over this instrument in the masterly manner which I see so many women ’s do .

text: They have not the same force or rapidity , and do not produce the same expression .
text_tokenized: They have not the same force or rapidity , and do not produce the same expression .

text: But then I have always supposed it to be my own fault -- because I would not take the trouble of practising .
text_tokenized: But then I have always supposed it to be my own fault -- because I would not take the trouble of practising .

text: It is not that I do not believe _ my _ fingers as capable as any other woman ’s of superior execution . ”
text_tokenized: It is not that I do not believe _ my _ fingers as capable as any other woman ’s of superior execution . ”

text: Darcy smiled and said , “ You are perfectly right .
text_tokenized: Darcy smiled and said , “ You are perfectly right .

text: You have employed your time much better .
text_tokenized: You have employed your time much better .

text: No one admitted to the privilege of hearing you can think anything wanting .
text_tokenized: No one admitted to the privilege of hearing you can think anything wanting .

text: We neither of us perform to strangers . ”
text_tokenized: We neither of us perform to strangers . ”

text: Here they were interrupted by Lady Catherine , who called out to know what they were talking of .
text_tokenized: Here they were interrupted by Lady Catherine , who called out to know what they were talking of .

text: Elizabeth immediately began playing again .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth immediately began playing again .

text: Lady Catherine approached , and , after listening for a few minutes , said to Darcy,-- “ Miss Bennet would not play at all amiss if she practised more , and could have the advantage of a London master .
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine approached , and , after listening for a few minutes , said to Darcy,-- “ Miss Bennet would not play at all amiss if she practised more , and could have the advantage of a London master .

text: She has a very good notion of fingering , though her taste is not equal to Anne ’s .
text_tokenized: She has a very good notion of fingering , though her taste is not equal to Anne ’s .

text: Anne would have been a delightful performer , had her health allowed her to learn . ”
text_tokenized: Anne would have been a delightful performer , had her health allowed her to learn . ”

text: Elizabeth looked at Darcy , to see how cordially he assented to his cousin ’s praise : but neither at that moment nor at any other could she discern any symptom of love ; and

text: Lady Catherine continued her remarks on Elizabeth ’s performance , mixing with them many instructions on execution and taste .

text: Elizabeth received them with all the forbearance of civility ; and at the request of the gentlemen remained at the instrument till her Ladyship ’s carriage was ready to take them all home .
